title: WebAuthn
extract: WebAuthn (Web Authentication) is an effort by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), with input from the FIDO Alliance, to standardize an interface for public-key authentication of users to web-based applications and services. It implements an extension of the W3C's more general Credential Management API, which is an attempt to formalize the interaction between websites and web browsers when exchanging user credentials.
extract_html: WebAuthn (Web Authentication) is an effort by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), with input from the FIDO Alliance, to standardize an interface for public-key authentication of users to web-based applications and services. It implements an extension of the W3C's more general Credential Management API, which is an attempt to formalize the interaction between websites and web browsers when exchanging user credentials.
